text: Douglas Gerald Hurley (born October 21, 1966) is an American engineer, former Marine Corps pilot, and former NASA astronaut. He piloted Space Shuttle missions STS-127 (July 2009) and STS-135 (July 2011), the final flight of the Space Shuttle program. He launched into space for the third time as Commander of Crew Dragon Demo-2, the first crewed spaceflight from American soil since STS-135. He was also the first Marine to fly the F/A-18 E/F Super Hornet. ==References== Category:1966 births Category:Living people Category:American astronauts Category:Engineers from New York (state) Category:Scientists from New York (state) Category:People from Endicott, New York
title: Doug Hurley
